summary: An email from Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman, with a forwarded message and autopsy photo attachments, questioning the official findings of Jeffrey Epstein's death by hanging. The email points to abrasions above the noose line and bruises on the wrists and arms as evidence inconsistent with a hanging.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: He is the sender of the email, forwarding autopsy photos and questioning the official narrative of Jeffrey Epstein's death by hanging.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: She is the recipient of the email from Mark Epstein, which contains autopsy photos and commentary on Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE4' in the email subject; the autopsy photos and analysis pertain to his death in custody.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is communicating about Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy, suggesting a familial or close personal connection, likely his brother.
Mark Epstein is sending an email with forensic analysis and attachments to Stacey Richman.

events.title: Autopsy Analysis of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Mark Epstein forwards autopsy photos and provides analysis arguing that abrasions above the noose line and bruises on the wrists and arms are inconsistent with death by hanging.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Autopsy
events.description: Mark Epstein sends an email to attorney Stacey Richman containing autopsy photos and commentary questioning the official cause of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein forwarded autopsy photos (PATH-Autopsy_032.JPG, PATH-Autopsy_039.JPG, PATH-Autopsy_042.JPG) related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The email argues that abrasions found above the noose line on Jeffrey Epstein's neck are inconsistent with death by hanging, which typically causes abrasions below the noose line.
The email also notes the presence of bruises on Jeffrey Epstein's wrists and arms, implying potential foul play or restraint.
The correspondence suggests ongoing skepticism or investigation into the official narrative of Jeffrey Epstein's death by individuals close to him.
